lead_paragraph: A deadlocked court refused to revive parts of the law that a federal appeals court had struck down as an effort to “target African Americans with almost surgical precision.”

byline.contributor: Alan Blinder contributed reporting from Atlanta.

headline.print_headline: State’s Law That Curbs Black Vote Is Rejected
headline.main: Supreme Court Blocks North Carolina From Restoring Strict Voting Law

snippet: A deadlocked court refused to revive parts of the law that a federal appeals court had struck down as an effort to “target African Americans with almost surgical precision.”...
abstract: Supreme Court refuses to restore parts of North Carolina's restrictive voting law after becoming deadlocked on issue; decision means earlier appeals court ruling, striking down five parts of law deemed discriminatory against African-American voters, still stands; civil rights groups critical of law applaud ruling, which included no reasoning.
